Bibliographic References: Ex Basel Market, M u M , Auktion 56, 19 Feb. 1980, no. 121, ill. on pi. 56; Kat. Hbg., no. 331, ill. on p. 383; Weis, AJA 86, 1982, p. 35, no. 22, pi. 3, fig. 14; see Schauenburg, RM 90, 1983, p. 354.
Imagery Description: Int.: nude youth bound to treeNon Sepcifiedtrunk, approached by bearded man with phiale in right hand and stick in left. Ext.: r.f. laurel, with white vein and berries. Anne Weis (loc. cit.) suggests that a possible interpretation of the scene would be Herakles about to free Peirithoos or Theseus from imprisonment in Hades, although she admits that the bearded man has none of the usual attributes of the hero.
Artist: The Painter of Naples 2585 and his circle
